definition: to carry on intimately with (idiom); ardent relationship (esp. between lovers)/billing and cooing
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: The season's in full swing now.
sentences.chinese: 現在球季正打得火熱呢。

sentences.english: Lee goes down well with the carrier bag people.
sentences.chinese: 李與購物袋公司的人打得火熱。

sentences.english: Are you blind, I'm making out with a 12, I am winning.
sentences.chinese: 你沒看到我正和一個12分的打得火熱，我贏回來了。

sentences.english: He's taken up with a divorced woman, I understand.
sentences.chinese: 我想他正和一個離婚的女人打得火熱。

sentences.english: We see the union leaders cheek by jowl with the capitalists.
sentences.chinese: 我們看到工會領導人和資本家們打得火熱。

sentences.english: My friend was rapt with this young lady he’d met.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友和一個他認識的女孩正打得火熱。

definition: to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
quarrelsome but loving couple
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to get straight to the point (idiom)
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
loner/single person/bachelor
major turning point of lifelong import (esp. marriage)
powerless to defend oneself (idiom); helpless
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
to make do in difficult circumstances by being resourceful/(of circumstances) difficult/challenging/(of a budget) tight/(of a man-made thing) makeshift/rough and ready
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
to resume a meeting
